intro: Maerua uguenensis, commonly known as the East African thornbush, is a shrub native to regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually small and succulent, aiding in water retention. Maerua uguenensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and forage for wildlife.
